result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defense is requesting a status date.
BTC: Matters adjourned.

copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible

8:38 AM Prosecuting attorney Kelly Larsen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lorenzo A Carranza not in court. DAR Court Reporter Amanda Chentnik. 
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited. - stay until 5PM on 7-26-22

BACK ON THE RECORD 10:12AM -
Deft Lorenzo Carranza now appears in person in court, all other appearances remain the same.
BTC: VACATE WARRANT, reinstate bond.
Deft has not gone to the SPD's office.
Atty info given to the deft.
Deft indicates he has an atty he plans to contact.
BTC: Matters adjourned.

DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive unless properly licensed.
